CatDescriptText: Anna Wilson, housewife, Somers Drive and Marie Wise, housewife, Terrace Village, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, October 29, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think there is too much emphasis placed on sports in high school and college?"  Mrs. Wilson's answer reads: "I think there's too much emphasis on sports and not enough emphasis on education, because we're living in very difficult times."  Mrs. Wise's answer reads: "No, there's not too much emphasis on sports."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Anna Wilson wearing light colored coat and eyeglasses, standing in front of C.C. Mellor store, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Marie Wise wearing double breasted trenchcoat with faux fur collar, standing in front of door, man, and sign for Chapel
